cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles E of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW then NW, cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night and move into the central Gulf of Mexico Sunday, tracking toward the north-western Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Texas) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near Louisiana (vicinity of the lower Mississippi River delta)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla including the Bay Islands of Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Nicaraguan and Honduran coasts, eastern Yucatan Peninsula, and the U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible early next week, but current probability is low (~5%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor to moderate surge could propagate up the lower Mississippi River; 3+ ft possible if the system strengthens and makes a close landfall
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could produce more than 4 inches Monday-Tuesday, creating localized flooding near the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: River flooding and resulting navigation restrictions; potential debris and reduced visibility impacting port operations
